_header: And in this fair way perceive I well a thing
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 159.
Title(s): The Talis of the Fyve Bestes
_description: The Talis of the Fyve Bestes — 422 lines in couplets

Asloan.First Lines:
…And in þis fair way perfaif I wele a thingTo no gud
                    rest þis nyt It sal ws bring…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…Beseike we him þat bocht ws with his bludEternale god
                    þe ground of euery gud
Asloan.Note:
MS also paginated = pp. 473-486; nineteenth-century transcripts in Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library La.IV.27 and Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library La.IV.28, item 2 and again item 10
                    (imperfect).
